intro: Randia bakeri, commonly known as the dwarf randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface. The flowers are small, clustered in terminal panicles, and are usually white or pale pink in color.
